channel.title: ~how to make portals work~
channel.description: ok i need to make a portal that will tele to some where. how do i make it so u click it and it teles u? source is delta

item.title: ~how to make portals work~
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

k Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: ~how to make portals work~
item.dc:creator: @theyungbubba theyungbubba
item.description:
@theyungbubba wrote:

-go into your objects list and find a portal id that hasnt been used (btw it doesnt have to be portal, it can be box, crate, table, door, mainly anything, just make sure it is not used)

-then remember that code, find the X and Y cord you wanna add it in…

-ok now go into your client.java, search “global” until you find something like
makeglobalobject, newglobalobject, ect. (somewhere between those lines)

-then copy one, and past it under it, then change the first numbers (e.g. 392) and change to that object you wanted, then change those two cords (e.g. XXXX, YYYY)

-then just search for "case "(with a space)

-then under the final bracket/brake (}) add this

    case ###:
        teleportToX = YOUR DESITNATION (X);
        teleportToY = YOUR DESTINATION (Y);
        sendMessage("You Have Teleported To (ADD PLACE HERE)");
        break;

Read full topic

item.title: ~how to make portals work~
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“SandScape, post:14, topic:321062”][quote author=b15 link=topic=417521.msg3069973#msg3069973 date=1261472090]
im stupid when it comes to cases. dont i also need to make a command if worldobject(“1655”) use case 9999. or all i do is add the case and the portal?
[/quote]

okay since you already got the portal added.

say your using portal 2465.

and you made a global object for it already so it comes up.

go to client java
&
search for:

portals

look for something that looks like this.

if(objectID = 3212)) {
toX = 3222;
toX = 3218;
{

place this after one of these.

if(objectID = 2465)) {
toX = Xcoord;
toY = Ycoord;
{

object id is the portal.
and then fill in your coords wear you see xcoord and ycoord.
this is so you can click the portal and it can teleport you.

then Just compile it.[/quote]

why are there 2 opening brackets and no closing?

if(objectID = 2465)) { toX = Xcoord; toY = Ycoord; }

Read full topic

item.title: ~how to make portals work~
item.dc:creator: @SandScape SandScape
item.description:
@SandScape wrote:

b15:

im stupid when it comes to cases. dont i also need to make a command if worldobject(“1655”) use case 9999. or all i do is add the case and the portal?

okay since you already got the portal added.

say your using portal 2465.

and you made a global object for it already so it comes up.

go to client java
&
search for:

portals

look for something that looks like this.

if(objectID = 3212)) {
toX = 3222;
toX = 3218;
}

place this after one of these.

if(objectID = 2465)) {
toX = Xcoord;
toY = Ycoord;
}

object id is the portal.
and then fill in your coords wear you see xcoord and ycoord.
this is so you can click the portal and it can teleport you.

then Just compile it.

It’s so simple…

item.title: ~how to make portals work~
item.dc:creator: @SmDaRgOn SmDaRgOn
item.description:
@SmDaRgOn wrote:

b15:

k thanks and were do i put it client.java?

Okay…Uhmm what is the code of the portal you want to add?

if ((objectID == 6551) && (objectX == 2668) && (objectY == 2648)) { triggerTele(2866, 9944, 0); sM("You teleported to godwars, Kill saradomin wizards for kill score"); }

If your using a delta source then you should have this portal…All portals work pretty much the same so you need to just the co-ordinates and objectID to the portal you want to use.

Read full topic
